result.execSummary:
The defendant Karessa Jayne Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karessa Jayne Patterson

Karessa Jayne Patterson, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel Guy M. Taylor.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.
No Contest plea entered on Count 1.  Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated.  Factual basis found.
  Defendant advised of post conviction relief.

Karessa Jayne Patterson, defendant appeared in Court in custody by video with counsel Guy M. Taylor.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.
  Court advises defendant of rights. Defendant given complaint. Defendant waives reading of complaint. Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.

Violation: Misd. Bail Jumping; repeater

Violation: Misd. Bail Jumping; repeater
Issuing Agency: GCSD
Conditions:  May not possess or consume any intoxicants.

Karessa Jayne Patterson, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy M. Taylor. Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Court advises defendant of rights. Defendant given complaint. Defendant waives reading of complaint. Court advises defendant of charges and penalties. Defendant waives speedy trial. Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf. Mr Luhman informs the Court that the Defendant is on a probation hold and is requesting $50 cash bond and $450 signature bond. Condition: May not possess or consume any intoxicants. Traffic cases to follow along with this case.  Initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
